trans-unit.source: Represents a row within a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView"></xref> control.
The FormViewRow class is used to represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.
Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control has a designated row type.
The following table lists the different row types.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowType.DataRow`|The data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow`|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.

The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control when there are no records to display.| |`DataControlRowType.Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| To determine the row type of a FormViewRow object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowType%2A> property.
A FormViewRow object also has a state associated with it.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.

|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The FormViewRow object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Insert`|The FormViewRow object is in insert mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The FormViewRow object is in its normal (default) state.| |`DataControlRowState.Selected`|The FormViewRow object is selected.| To determine the state of a FormViewRow object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control displays the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.ItemTemplate%2A> property in a data row.
To access the data row, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.Row%2A> property.
To determine the index of the current data item in the data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.ItemIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the FormViewRow object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property.

If a cell contains controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using one of the following methods: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell to retrieve the control at a specific index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to retrieve the control, if the control has its <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property set.
This is the preferred method to retrieve a control from a cell.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the FormViewRow class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> class.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.ItemIndex%2A>|The value specified by the `itemIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowType%2A>|The value specified by the `rowType` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowState%2A>|The value specified by the `rowState` parameter.|
The index of the data item in the data source.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> enumeration values.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the index of the data item displayed from the data source.
Use the ItemIndex property to determine the index of the data item.
The index of the data item displayed from the data source.
Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
The event data.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event has been canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Renders the control to the specified HTML writer.
The HTML text writer object that receives the control content.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the RowState property to determine the state of the row.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.

|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Insert`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in insert mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in its normal, read-only state.| |`DataControlRowState.Selected`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is selected.| This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the row type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the RowType property to determine the type of row that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object represents.
The following table lists the different row type values.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowType.DataRow`|The data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow`|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.

The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control when there are no records to display.| |`DataControlRowType.Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Separator`|A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| This property is commonly used to determine a row's type before performing an operation.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> values.
